content: smooth tuck in the sides and make sure the bag has as few wrinkles as possible we have found that you can stack bags before folding to speed up the process aim for 2-3 bags per stack any more and the stack gets hard to fold and hard to cut then fold the bags in half handles touching handles and bottom touching the bottom repeat this fold going the same direc- tion now the bag is ready to be cut remove the bottom and handles and discard cut the rest of the bag into two inch strips the strips don t need to be exactly two inches but a ruler or gridded cutting mat helps in keeping things consistent 4 full-length plarn instructions continued your two-inch strips once unfolded will be loops of plastic loop the loops together by bringing one loop through the other and then through itself this is also called a larks-head knot so try looking that up if you have a hard time with this keep stringing the loops together in this manner until you have a long string of loops i find this to be the most tedious part of the whole project but my boyfriend finds it relaxing there s no minimum length of plarn string but there is a maximum the string when rolled into a ball needs to be able to pass through one loop this is how you will attach your new balls when crocheting no ends to weave in also loops break be careful how much gauge you put on them but things happen the plarn becomes much more durable when worked up into a mat once you have a good length of plarn roll it into a ball like i do or wrap it into a bundle of some sort something you can work with later you ve made plarn plarn can be knit or crocheted just like any other super bulky yarn i ve only made sleeping mats but i ve seen others make bas- kets shopping bags and more read on for instructions on how to crochet a sleeping mat 5 full-length crochet instructions crochet mat essentially the crochet mat is a big single_crochet rectangle 70 stitches wide and 6 feet 180cm tall i estimate the height by hold- ing it up to myself and knowing about how much taller the mat needs to be than me the height doesn t have to be exact instructions chain 71 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook 1 single_crochet in each chain to end chain 1 and turn *1 single_crochet in each chain to end chain 1 and turn repeat from * until piece is roughly 6 feet 180cm tall if using new yarn for border fasten_off if not continue to border border now you re adding a single_crochet border to your mat i like to use a contrasting color of plarn for my border but this is all per- sonal preference if attaching a new ball join at
